sections.content: Golf content spans instruction, course vlogs, equipment reviews, and entertainment. Viewers want to see swing mechanics clearly, experience beautiful courses, and learn to improve their game. High frame rate for swings and stable footage for walking are essential. Here's what golf YouTubers use.

faq.question: Best camera for golf swing?
faq.answer: iPhone Pro does 240fps slo-mo—very effective. Sony A7S III for pro quality 4K at 120fps. Any camera with 120fps+ works for analysis. Tripod or mount essential for consistent angles.

faq.question: Can I film on any golf course?
faq.answer: Always get permission first. Many courses welcome content for exposure. Some restrict or prohibit filming. Establish relationships with local courses. Private clubs often more restrictive.

faq.question: Audio challenges on course?
faq.answer: Wind is major issue—deadcat windscreens mandatory. Wireless lavalier under clothing helps. Consider ADR/voiceover for windy days. Natural course sounds add ambiance when controlled.

faq.question: Should I use a drone?
faq.answer: Drone footage elevates production significantly. Check course rules and local regulations. Many courses near airports restrict drones. Beautiful establishing shots and hole flyovers worth the effort.
